description:
'''Francis Edward Turner''' (born 28 December 1981) is an English [[Punk rock|punk]] and [[Folk music|folk]] singer-songwriter from [[Meonstoke]], Hampshire. He began his career as the vocalist of [[post-hardcore]] band [[Million Dead]], then embarked upon a primarily acoustic-based solo career following the band's split in 2005. In the studio and during live performances, Turner is accompanied by his backing band, The Sleeping Souls, which consists of [[Ben Lloyd]] (guitar, mandolin), Tarrant Anderson (bass), [[Matt Nasir]] (piano, mandolin) and Callum Green (drums).

To date, Turner has released ten solo albums, four rarities compilation albums, one retrospective "best of" album, one split album and five [[Extended play|EPs]]. Turner's ninth studio album, ''[[FTHC]]'' was released on 11 February 2022 and reached number 1 in the UK albums chart in the week following its release.
